intro: Parameria wariana, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Parameria wariana thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests.
